1.text: Paul, an apostle, (not of men, neither by man, but by Jesus Christ, and God the Father, who raised him from the dead;)

2.text: And all the brothers which are with me, to the churches of Galatia:

3.text: Grace be to you and peace from God the Father, and from our Lord Jesus Christ,

4.text: Who gave himself for our sins, that he might deliver us from this present evil world, according to the will of God and our Father:

5.text: To whom be glory for ever and ever. Amen.

6.text: I marvel that you are so soon removed from him that called you into the grace of Christ to another gospel:

7.text: Which is not another; but there be some that trouble you, and would pervert the gospel of Christ.

8.text: But though we, or an angel from heaven, preach any other gospel to you than that which we have preached to you, let him be accursed.

9.text: As we said before, so say I now again, if any man preach any other gospel to you than that you have received, let him be accursed.

10.text: For do I now persuade men, or God? or do I seek to please men? for if I yet pleased men, I should not be the servant of Christ.

11.text: But I certify you, brothers, that the gospel which was preached of me is not after man.

12.text: For I neither received it of man, neither was I taught it, but by the revelation of Jesus Christ.

13.text: For you have heard of my conversation in time past in the Jews’ religion, how that beyond measure I persecuted the church of God, and wasted it:

14.text: And profited in the Jews’ religion above many my equals in my own nation, being more exceedingly zealous of the traditions of my fathers.

15.text: But when it pleased God, who separated me from my mother’s womb, and called me by his grace,

16.text: To reveal his Son in me, that I might preach him among the heathen; immediately I conferred not with flesh and blood:

17.text: Neither went I up to Jerusalem to them which were apostles before me; but I went into Arabia, and returned again to Damascus.

18.text: Then after three years I went up to Jerusalem to see Peter, and stayed with him fifteen days.

19.text: But other of the apostles saw I none, save James the Lord’s brother.

20.text: Now the things which I write to you, behold, before God, I lie not.

21.text: Afterwards I came into the regions of Syria and Cilicia;

22.text: And was unknown by face to the churches of Judaea which were in Christ:

23.text: But they had heard only, That he which persecuted us in times past now preaches the faith which once he destroyed.

24.text: And they glorified God in me.
